paper_metadata.title: Community planning under the NALEP focal area approach

program_information.program_name: National Agriculture and Livestock Extension Programme (NALEP)

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: The MOARD staff provide specific information on technologies and enterprises, link community groups with other providers of material, technical and market support, provide training in technical and business skills, arrange cross-site exchange visits to other communities, and provide a few material inputs for community infrastructure.

study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: The NALEP approach begins with a five-day participatory rural appraisal involving subject-matter specialists, front-line extension workers and the rural communities.

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: The NALEP approach begins with a five-day participatory rural appraisal involving subject-matter specialists, front-line extension workers and the rural communities.

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The National Agriculture and Livestock Extension Programme (NALEP) is implemented by the Kenya Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development in forty-two districts.
evidence_citations.country_citation: The National Agriculture and Livestock Extension Programme (NALEP) is implemented by the Kenya Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development in forty-two districts.
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: extension staff concentrate their support in one or two focal areas of about 300 hectares and 400 households in each division each financial year
